    • Method Detail

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        Starts the game, creating the match's board and filling it with snakes and ladders based on the match's attributes.
        Pre: A match instance has been created.
        Post: A board has been created with the match's attributes.

      • searchField

        public Field searchField(Field lastField,
                         int position)
        Returns a field given an initial field and a position.
        If 'position-1' is greater than 0, the method will call himself again, either with 'lastField' or 'nextField' and 'position-1' as parameters. 'lastField' is assigned to the method's value
        If that isn't the case, the method will return lastField.
        Pre: A board has been created. Post: Returns the board's field given the initial field and a position.
        Parameters:
        lastField - the initial field.
        position - the position after that initial field.
        Returns:
        Returns the board's field given the initial field and a position.

      • addAllSnakes

        public void addAllSnakes(int snakeAmount,
                         int fieldAmount,
                         int tries,
                         int count)
        This method adds a certain amount of snakes to the board and assigns them a symbol. If snakeAmount is greater than 0, a snake will be attempted to be added and the method will call himself again, with 'snakeAmount-1' and 'count+1' as parameters.
        Pre: A board has been created.
        Post: A certain amount of snakes have been added to the board.
        Parameters:
        snakeAmount - the amount of snakes to be added.
        fieldAmount - the board's field amount.
        tries - the number of tries for adding a snake.
        count - a counter to give the snake's symbol.

      • addAllLadders

        public void addAllLadders(int ladderAmount,
                          int fieldAmount,
                          int tries,
                          int count)
        This method adds a certain amount of ladders to the board and assigns them a symbol.
        If ladderAmount is greater than 0, a ladder will be attempted to be added and the method will call himself again, with 'ladderAmount-1' and 'count+1' as parameters.
        Pre: A board has been created.
        Post: A certain amount of ladders have been added to the board.
        Parameters:
        ladderAmount - the amount of ladders to be added.
        fieldAmount - the board's field amount.
        tries - the number of tries for adding a ladder.
        count - a counter to give the ladder's symbol.

      • addPlayer

        public void addPlayer(char symbol)
        Creates and adds a player to the match.
        A player is created using 'symbol' as a parameter, and it is assigned to 'firstPlayer' if it is null. If it isn't the case, the method addPlayer is called with 'firstPlayer' and 'newPlayer' as parameters.
        Pre: A match instance has been created.
        Post: A player has been added to the match.
        Parameters:
        symbol - - the player's symbol to represent them in the game.

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer(Player lastPlayer,
                        int position)
        Returns a player given an initial player and a position. If 'position-1' is greater than 0, the method will call himself again with 'selectedPlayer' and 'position-1' as parameters. 'lastPlayer' is assigned to the method's value
        If that isn't the case, the method will return 'lastPlayer'.
        Pre: A player has been added before. Post: Returns a player given an initial player and a position.
        Parameters:
        lastPlayer - the initial player of the list.
        position - the position after that initial player.
        Returns:
        Returns a player given an initial player and a position.

      • movePlayers

        public int movePlayers(int turn,
                       int fieldAmount)
        Moves one of the added players depending of the match's turn. It moves the player 1 to 6 fields away from the initial field randomly.
        Pre: A board has been created, the players have been added.
        Post: Players move 1 to 6 fields in a random way, depending on the match's turn.
        Parameters:
        turn - the match's current turn.
        fieldAmount - the board's field amount.
        Returns:
        The amount of moves the moving player has done.

      • movePlayer

        public void movePlayer(Player player,
                       int moves,
                       int fieldAmount)
        Moves the given player to a field depending on the amount of moves.
        Pre: A board has been created, a player has been added.
        Post: A player has been moved to a new field given the amount of moves.
        Parameters:
        player - the player that is going to move.
        moves - the amount of fields that is going to go through.
        fieldAmount - the board's field amount.

      • boardToString

        public java.lang.String boardToString(boolean showPlayers)
        It returns a String with the match's board and all its elements.
        Pre: A board has been created.
        Post: The board is returned in a String, which shows all the board's fields and elements.
        Parameters:
        showPlayers - either shows players or not.
        Returns:
        Returns a String with the match's board and all its elements.

      • boardToString

        public java.lang.String boardToString(Field lastField,
                                      int fieldAmount,
                                      boolean showPlayers)
        It returns a String with the match's board and all its elements.
        Pre: The method boardToString has been called.
        Post: The board is returned in a String, which shows all the board's fields and elements.
        Parameters:
        lastField - the initial field of the board.
        fieldAmount - the amount of fields of the board.
        showPlayers - either shows players or not.
        Returns:
        Returns a String with the match's board and all its elements.

      • showNotWinnerSymbols

        public java.lang.String showNotWinnerSymbols()
        Gets a String with the symbols of the player who didn't win the match.
        Pre: A match has been created, players have been added and a winner has been decided.
        Post: Returns a String with the symbols of the player who didn't win the match.
        Returns:
        Returns a String with the symbols of the player who didn't win the match.
